author: nevertrustahippy
title: Read & build's a really bright idea
review:
This set is a great introduction to Duplo for prospective little builders.  While the set has a relatively low brick count for the price, the story book makes more than makes up for this.

The set's basic concept is that you read the story book and little builders make the two models as an interactive part of the story.  My experience is that this worked well. My little builders liked the story and the models, and kept playing with the models, Penny Pilot & Joe Racer, afterward. 

The set's strengths are the two good models (Penny's plane and Joe's car) and the quality book.  Penny's plane has two uncommon parts, the aircraft engine and the 2x4 underside curved brick.  The character face bricks are nicely printed and I might use them for some MOC Thomas the Tank Engine trains.   

The 12 page board book is up to Lego's usually high standards -well illustrated, made of quality cardboard and has pretty good rhyming verse.  

Play-ability is quite high for such a small set with its two characters/models and the story is just right for getting play started.  

The only downsides to the set is the high price per brick and perhaps that as a starter set it is a bit limited in the number of bricks - you need more for really creative play. 

All in all a good purchase for preschoolers.
